Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GenericGamePiece, Striker

    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a circular piece. It is an interactive, moving piece.
    Author:
    calix

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double EPSILON
      An epsilon used for double comparisons.
      static double NEGLIGIBLE_VEL
      An epsilon representing the threshold for motion to be considered not motion.

      • Piece

        public Piece(double x,
             double y,
             double radius,
             double friction,
             int R,
             int G,
             int B)
        Instantiates a piece with color.
        Parameters:
        x - initial x pos
        y - initial y pos
        radius - radius
        friction - friction value to be used
        R - R value in RGB [0,255] inclusive
        G - G value in RGB [0,255] inclusive
        B - B value in RGB [0,255] inclusive

      • setLoc

        public void setLoc(double x,
                   double y,
                   double minX,
                   double minY,
                   double maxX,
                   double maxY)
        Sets location of the piece in given boundaries. If outside, it will move to the closest valid point (inside the boundaries).
        Parameters:
        x - the new x location
        y - the new y location
        minX - the left boundary
        minY - the top boundary
        maxX - the right boundary
        maxY - the bottom boundary

        Parameters:

                    double minX,
                    double minY,
                    double maxX,
                    double maxY)
        This method will make one piece collide with many others
        Parameters:
        others - the ArrayList of Pieces that this piece should collide with

      • collide

        public void collide(Piece that,
                    double minX,
                    double minY,
                    double maxX,
                    double maxY)
        Makes one piece collide with another within a certain set of bounds.
        Parameters:
        that - the other piece
        minX - left boundary
        minY - top boundary
        maxX - right boundary
        maxY - bottom boundary

      • score

        public abstract int score(double minX,
                          double minY,
                          double maxX,
                          double maxY,
                          double radius)
        Gives the score of a piece at where it is, given the bounds of the board and radius of corner holes.
        Parameters:
        minX - left boundary
        minY - top boundary
        maxX - right boundary
        maxY - top boundary
        radius - radius of the hole in the corner
        Returns:
        The score that the piece should net at its current XY location in those bounds
